document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Grismado, C. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Grismado, C. J. (2008) A taxonomic revision of the spider genus Ariadna Audouin, 1826 in Argentina and Chile, with the description of five new species (Arachnida, Araneae, Segestriidae). Zoosystema, 30 (2), 333 - 360.
bibRefCitation.title: A taxonomic revision of the spider genus Ariadna Audouin, 1826 in Argentina and Chile, with the description of five new species (Arachnida, Araneae, Segestriidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ariadna calilegua Grismado, 2008 : 338
, figs 3A‒B, 4A‒D (♂ holotype from Mesada de las Colmenas, Ruta Provincial no. 83, Parque Nacional Calilegua [23°55'S; 64°50'W], Ledesma department, Jujuy Province, Argentina, 25.X.1983 , G. Lingua leg., deposited in MACN-Ar 10087, examined).— Grismado & Izquierdo (2014 : 154, figs 14a‒b).— World Spider Catalog (2018) .

Additional material examined. ARGENTINA :
Salta Province :
17km N La Caldera
[ 24°36'S ; 65°23'W ],
Alto de la Sierra
,
1550m
, 1♂ ,
2‒30.XII.1987
, S. & J. Peck leg. ( AMNH )
;
22km N La Caldera
, El Ucumar ,
1550m
, 1♂ ( AMNH );
Tucumán Province :
Tapia [ 26°36'11"S ; 65°15'41"W ],
700m
, 1♀ 2imm., J. Daniels leg. ( NHM 1903.4.1.284‒286).

Diagnosis.
Ariadna calilegua
is similar to
A. crassipalpa
,
A. mollis
,
A. boesenbergi
,
A. changellkuk , A. levii
and
A. perkinsi
due to the dark abdominal pattern with arrow-shaped marks ( Figs 1A‒C , 18A, F , 20A, F , 22A, F , 31A, E , 45A, F , 47A, F , 50A, F ), but differ, except
A. crassipalpa
, by the presence of males with metatarsi I bearing a blunt ventro-prolateral macrosetae on an apophysis located on its median region ( Fig. 45C‒E ); it differs from
A. crassipalpa
by presenting the curvature of the midportion and embolus more marked, and a thinner embolus ( Fig. 46A‒B ); females are distinguished, except from
A. crassipalpa
, by the presence of an anterior receptaculum with an irregular cuticle ( Fig. 46C‒D ). It differs from
A. crassipalpa
by the presence of prolateral macrosetae on patellae I‒II ( Fig. 45H ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 45.
Ariadna calilegua Grismado, 2008
. Male from 22km N La Caldera (AMNH) (A‒E): habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral (B); right leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D); right metatarsi I, ventral view (E). Female from Tapia (NHM 1903.4.1.284‒286) (F‒I): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); right leg I, prolateral (H) (arrowhead = prolateral macrosetae on the patella) and retrolateral view (I). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 46.
Ariadna calilegua Grismado, 2008
. Male from 22km N La Caldera (AMNH) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral (A) and retrolateral view (B). Female from Tapia (NHM 1903.4.1.284‒286) (C‒D): internal genitalia, lateral view (C); anterior receptaculum, ventral view (D). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Male (n=3): Total length 7.19‒9.4; carapace 3.6‒4.56 long, 2.32‒2.96 wide; femur I 3.36‒4.08.
